New Records: Suryakumar Yadav registered his third T20I century and first for India in 2023 off just 45 balls.
Yuzvendra Chahal equalled Bhuvneshwar Kumar's feat of most T20I wickets for India with a total of 90 scalps.
Key Match Events: India won the 3rd T20I by 91 runs, clinching the series 2-1.
India set a target of 229 for Sri Lanka in the series decider.
Suryakumar Yadav scored a century off 45 balls.
Chahal took his second wicket of the match, dismissing Dhananjaya de Silva.
Sri Lanka were 135/8 after 16 overs, making it nearly impossible for them to win.
Shivam Mavi impressed with a brilliant catch to dismiss Charith Asalanka.
Hardik Pandya dismissed Avishka Fernando just after the powerplay.
Axar Patel and Arshdeep Singh dismissed Kusal Mendis and Pathum Nissanka, respectively, leaving Sri Lanka at 51/2 after the powerplay.
Madushanka dismissed Ishan Kishan in the first over of the game.
Rahul Tripathi and Shubman Gill hammered Madushanka in the third over, scoring 15 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Hardik Pandya mentioned that India would bat first and emphasized focusing on playing good cricket.
Dasun Shanaka stated that Sri Lanka would have batted first as well and aimed to set the tone upfront.
Both teams were geared up to clinch the three-match T20I series after a narrow last-ball win for India in the opener and a 16-run win for Sri Lanka in the second match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Live streaming of the 3rd T20I between India and Sri Lanka was available on the Disney+ Hotstar app and Star Sports Network.
